resources.string: Add a worry to get started
Cognitive distortions are negative thought patterns that lead to worry.
Recognizing these distortions can help us see situations more clearly and manage our worries effectively.
Believing a single negative event represents a pattern and drawing overly broad conclusions
Assuming you know what others are thinking
Predicting bad things will happen without any real evidence
Viewing small problems as much more serious than they truly are
Viewing situations only as good or bad, with no middle ground
Focusing only on the negative parts of a situation, while disregarding the positive
Dismissing or ignoring positive experiences, feedback, or accomplishments
Blaming yourself for events or outcomes that are out of your control
Assuming how you feel reflects reality
Assigning labels to yourself or others
All worries come to an end
